data.title: 10 Youngest Bollywood Actresses
data.meta_description: Discover the 10 Youngest Bollywood Actresses here. Prepare to be transported into a rich & fascinating history on the youngest bollywood actresses that exist.
data.text:
Bollywood has always been known for the brightest stars and the most beautiful film industry in the world. The beauty of these ladies is reason enough to support them and watch their movies repeatedly. Most are pretty young, but some have proved they are talented and versatile actresses.

They have also proved that they are not just beautiful faces but also great actresses. With a string of hits, dubbing of big Hollywood films, and a lot of hype around their upcoming releases, some are just exceptional and loved by their fans because of their pure and natural talent.

Read on to learn more about these 10 youngest actresses of Bollywood.

10. Kiara Advani (July 31, 1991 – present)

photo source: Wikipedia

Indian actress Kiara Advani performs in Hindi and Telugu movies. The Hindi ensemble comedy Fugly served as Advani’s debut performance (2014). Advani gained further recognition for his roles in Kabir Singh, a romantic drama, and Good Newz, a comedic drama, two of the highest-grossing Hindi movies of 2019.

For the latter, she received the IIFA Award for Best Supporting Actress. Shershaah, for which she was nominated for a Filmfare Award for Best Actress, and the 2022 movies Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2, Jugjugg Jeeyo, and Govinda Naam Mera all contributed to her sustained fame.

Did You Know?

Kiara Advani participated in the Giordano handbags 2019 campaign as a brand spokesperson.

9. Alia Bhatt (March 15, 1993 – present)

photo source: Glamour

British actress Alia Bhatt is of Indian ancestry and primarily appears in Hindi-language movies. She is the Bhatt family’s first-born child and the daughter of actor Soni Razdan and director Mahesh Bhatt.

In Karan Johar’s adolescent drama Student of the Year, she performed her first leading part after completing her acting debut as a youngster in the 1999 thriller Sangharsh (2012).

As a kidnapping victim in the road drama Highway (2014), she won the Filmfare Critics Award for Best Actress. She later established herself with leading roles in several movies, including the coming-of-age drama Dear Zindagi (2016). She is one of the highest-paid actors in India and has been named to Forbes India’s Celebrity 100 list since 2014.

Did You Know?

In 2022, she received the TIME100 Impact Award.

8. Sara Ali Khan (August 12, 1995 – present)

photo source: Wikipedia

Indian actress Sara Ali Khan appears in Hindi-language movies. She is the daughter of actress Amrita Singh and Saif Ali Khan and was raised in the Pataudi dynasty. Khan made her acting debut in 2018 with the romance film Kedarnath and the action comedy Simmba after earning a degree in political science and history from Columbia University.

She won the Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut for the first of her two financially successful movies.

Khan made her acting debut in 2018’s Kedarnath, a love story starring Sushant Singh Rajput as a Muslim porter and a Hindu girl who falls in love. Khan worked with Rajput to expand her vocabulary in Hindi to prepare for her part.

Did You Know?

With an estimated yearly income of 57.5 million (US$720,000), Khan was ranked 66th on Forbes India’s Celebrity 100 list in 2019.

7. Tara Sutaria (November 19, 1995 – present)

photo source: Hindustan Times

Indian actress and musician Tara Sutaria appears in Hindi language movies. She debuted in Disney India’s Big Bada Boom as a singer before switching to acting in the sitcoms The Suite Life of Karan & Kabir (2012) and Oye Jassie on the channel (2013). As Student of the Year 2, which she received the Zee Cine Award for as Best Female Debut, Sutaria made her feature debut in 2019.

Sutaria began working for Disney Channel India as a video jockey and remained there throughout her career, producing two popular comedies. She has also recorded music for movies, commercials, and her creative work in India and overseas.

Her song “Slippin’ Through My Fingers” is included in Bharat Dhabholkar’s Blame It On Yashraj, an Ashwin Gidwani production.

Did You Know?

She has performed in operas and competitions since she was seven years old and has been a professional vocalist.

6. Sanjana Sanghi (September 2, 1996 – present)

photo source: IMDb

Sanjana Sanghi is an Indian model and actress who primarily appears in Hindi-language movies. She attended the Modern School in Delhi and graduated in 2017 with a journalism and mass communication degree from Lady Shri Ram College in Delhi. Sanghi made her acting debut in 2011’s love movie Rockstar, directed by Imtiaz Ali.

After seeing her perform on stage at her school, Mukesh Chhabra cast her. In the 2011 movie Rockstar, she made her acting debut as a young performer.

Later on, she had brief appearances in Hindi Medium and Fukrey Returns. She portrayed a pupil in Jai’s class in Baar Baar Dekho in 2016. She portrayed Katty in Fukrey Returns and Saba Qamar’s younger self in Hindi Medium in 2017.

Did You Know?

Sanghi is most recognized for playing a terminally ill cancer patient in her first leading role in the Sushant Singh Rajput movie Dil Bechara.

5. Manushi Chhillar (May 14, 1997 – present)

photo source: Wikipedia

Manushi Chhillar made her Bollywood debut in Chandraprakash Dwivedi’s Samrat Prithviraj for Yash Raj Films. The story of Prithviraj Chauhan, a Rajput monarch from the Chahamana dynasty, is told in Prithviraj Raso, an epic poem written in the Braj Bhasha language.

With Yash Raj Films, Chhillar agreed to a three-picture contract. Her second film, The Great Indian Family, is a comedy that is once again supported by the studio and is directed by Vijay Krishna Acharya. Vicky Kaushal will be her co-star in this one.

Her mother, Dr. Neelam Chhillar, is a doctor and the department head of neurochemistry at the Institute of Human Behaviour and Allied Sciences. Her father, Dr. Mitra Basu Chhillar, is a doctor and scientist at the Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO).

Did You Know?

She competed as a representative of her home state of Haryana in the Femina Miss India 2017 competition, which she won. She then went on to become the sixth Indian to be named Miss World.

4. Janhvi Kapoor (March 6, 1997 – present)

photo source: Twitter

Janhvi Kapoor, born to Sridevi and Boney Kapoor, made her acting debut in the critically acclaimed love movie Dhadak in 2018. Her father, Boney Kapoor, founded the Anil Kapoor Films Company and is the son of the late director Surinder Kapoor. Her mother is the Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi cinema actress Sridevi. She is the niece of Sanjay and Anil Kapoor, two famous actors.

At age 21, Kapoor lost her mother when she was discovered drowned accidentally in her hotel room at the Jumeirah Emirates Towers in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

She studied acting at the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute in California before making her film debut.

Did You Know?

After portraying the lead aviator in the biography Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl, Kapoor was nominated for a Filmfare Award for Best Actress (2020).

3. Alaya Ebrahim Furniturewala (November 28, 1997 – present)

photo source: Pinterest

Actress Aalia Furniturewala, often known by her stage as Alaya F, is Indian and works in Hindi-language movies. She is the child of the actress Pooja Bedi and was raised in the Bedi family. With the comedy Jawaani Jaaneman, she made her acting debut in 2020, earning the Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut.

She later appeared in the suspenseful film Freddy (2022). In Mumbai, she attended Jamnabai Narsee School.

She obtained an acting credential from the New York Film Academy before making her film debut, changed her name to Alaya F, and is currently learning contemporary and Kathak dance. Next, Alaya starred with Kartik Aaryan in the 2022 film Freddy as Kainaaz Irani, a woman in a violent marriage.

Alaya is a well-known brand ambassador for several companies and goods, including Lenskart and Nykaa. In 2022, she was chosen to represent Nykaa’s “A Million Nakhras” campaign.

Did You Know?

In The Times of India’s “Most Desirable Women List” for 2020, Alaya came in at number 42.

2. Saiee Manjrekar (December 23, 1997 – present)

photo source: IMDb

Indian actress Saiee Manjrekar performs in Telugu, Marathi, and Hindi-language movies. She made her acting debut in Dabangg 3 (2019), for which she was nominated for a Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut. She is the daughter of actors Mahesh Manjrekar and Medha Manjrekar.

Since then, she has acted in Ghani and Major (both in 2022). Manjrekar made her acting debut in the Marathi movie Kaksparsh, where she had a brief cameo as Kushi Damle (2012).

In the 2019 Hindi action-comedy Dabangg 3, she portrays Khushi Chautala, playing her first leading role opposite Salman Khan. The picture garnered unfavorable reviews, and the CAA protests impacted its financial prospects. She was nominated for Best Female Debut at the Filmfare Awards because of it.

Alongside Aayush Sharma, she appeared in the music video for the song “Manjha” in 2020.

Did You Know?

In the 2019 Times Most Desirable Women List, Manjrekar came in at number 47.

1. Ananya Panday (October 30, 1998 – present)

photo source: RitzyStar

Ananya Panday, considered the youngest Bollywood actress, started her acting career in 2019 with parts in the comedies Pati Patni Aur Woh and the adolescent drama Student of the Year 2. She was given the Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut for her efforts in this role.

Her portrayal in the play Gehraiyaan (2022) earned higher reviews, but the films afterward were not well regarded.

Panday appeared in the action movie Khaali Peeli in 2020, which also starred Ishaan Khatter. On Zee Plex, the film was made available digitally. The love drama Gehraiyaan from 2022, made available on Amazon Prime Video, featured her next with Deepika Padukone and Siddhant Chaturvedi. her upcoming movie is The Untold Story of C Sankaran Nair.

Did You Know?

Panday, a celebrity brand advocate for numerous companies like Lakme and Gillette Venus, was named No. 37 in 2019 and No. 31 in 2020 on The Times of India’s list of the Most Desirable Women.
